news.title: BBC: Questions for Microsoft on open formats
news.body: Featured article by Georg Greve and Joachim Jakobs about the need for Open Standards in archival, and why using MS-OOXML creates incalculable risks: "Digital information could potentially be stored without loss of quality for a very long time to come. But without knowledge about the encoding, our documents will become a meaningless series of ones and zeroes to future generations, just like cave paintings are too often meaningless bits of colour on stone to us."
